paper_title.ja: 高圧中性子散乱ことはじめ

paper_title.en: Direct evidence of helifan structures in holmium by single crystal neutron diffraction

description.en: We give direct evidence of the existence of helifan structures, an intermediate phase between helix and fan, in holmium at 50 K in a magnetic field by single-crystal neutron-diffraction experiments. Two types of helifan structures, helifan(3/2) and helifan(2) have been observed at 1.4 and 2.0T, respectively. The magnetic structure successively changes with increasing magnetic field, from a normal helix at zero field to a helifan(3/2) structure, to a helifan(2) structure, to a fan structure and, finally, to an induced ferromagnetic structure. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Direct evidence of helifan structures in holmium by single crystal neutron diffraction

description.en: We give direct evidence of the existence of helifan structures, an intermediate phase between helix and fan, in holmium at 50 K in a magnetic field by single-crystal neutron-diffraction experiments. Two types of helifan structures, helifan(3/2) and helifan(2) have been observed at 1.4 and 2.0T, respectively. The magnetic structure successively changes with increasing magnetic field, from a normal helix at zero field to a helifan(3/2) structure, to a helifan(2) structure, to a fan structure and, finally, to an induced ferromagnetic structure. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Time-resolved X-ray Diffraction Study of C<sub>60</sub> at High Pressure and Tempetature.（共著）
paper_title.en: Time-resolved X-ray diffraction study of C-60 at high pressure and temperature

description.en: Energy-dispersive X-ray diffraction measurements on C-60 were undertaken at every 1-10 min interval while high temperature (200-800 degreesC) was held constant for at longest 3 h under pressures of 12.5 and 14.3 GPa. The results from this and additional experiments have provided an insight into the time, pressure, and temperature dependency of the fullerene-derived superhard materials. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Time-resolved X-ray diffraction study of C-60 at high pressure and temperature

description.en: Energy-dispersive X-ray diffraction measurements on C-60 were undertaken at every 1-10 min interval while high temperature (200-800 degreesC) was held constant for at longest 3 h under pressures of 12.5 and 14.3 GPa. The results from this and additional experiments have provided an insight into the time, pressure, and temperature dependency of the fullerene-derived superhard materials. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Pressure-induced irreversible amorphization of C<sub>70</sub> fullerene(共著)
paper_title.en: Pressure-induced irreversible amorphization of C-70 fullerene

description.en: We report Raman scattering study of Cio fullerene polycrystals undertaken at high static pressures up to 51 GPa using a diamond-anvil cell. Above 12 GPa, a majority of the intramolecular vibrational modes lost their intensities and only one broad peak initially centered at 1567 cm(-1) was found to persist, indicating an occurrence of amorphization. Analysis of the line width of the 1567 cm(-1) peak showed the amorphization to be completed by about 18 cpa. The amorphous phase was irreversibly retained to the ambient pressure after pressures higher than 35 GPa were applied. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Pressure-induced irreversible amorphization of C-70 fullerene

description.en: We report Raman scattering study of Cio fullerene polycrystals undertaken at high static pressures up to 51 GPa using a diamond-anvil cell. Above 12 GPa, a majority of the intramolecular vibrational modes lost their intensities and only one broad peak initially centered at 1567 cm(-1) was found to persist, indicating an occurrence of amorphization. Analysis of the line width of the 1567 cm(-1) peak showed the amorphization to be completed by about 18 cpa. The amorphous phase was irreversibly retained to the ambient pressure after pressures higher than 35 GPa were applied. (C) 2000 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Static compression of Ti<sub>3</sub>SiC<sub>2</sub> to 61 GPa.(共著)
paper_title.en: Static compression of Ti3SiC2 to 61 GPa

description.en: Synchrotron x-ray diffraction measurements have been made on hexagonal crystal Ti3SiC2 under pressures up to 61 GPa and at room temperature. No phase transition was observed within the pressure range studied. Both the a and c axes exhibited decreases with pressure, accompanied by a decrease in the c/a ratio to about 50 GPa, beyond which the ratio increased. The bulk modulus deduced from the volume-versus-pressure data was 206 +/- 6 GPa (with its pressure derivative 4.0 +/- 0.3), being close to that of TiC. (C) 1999 American Institute of Physics. [S0003-6951(99)01725-8].

paper_title.en: Static compression of Ti3SiC2 to 61 GPa

description.en: Synchrotron x-ray diffraction measurements have been made on hexagonal crystal Ti3SiC2 under pressures up to 61 GPa and at room temperature. No phase transition was observed within the pressure range studied. Both the a and c axes exhibited decreases with pressure, accompanied by a decrease in the c/a ratio to about 50 GPa, beyond which the ratio increased. The bulk modulus deduced from the volume-versus-pressure data was 206 +/- 6 GPa (with its pressure derivative 4.0 +/- 0.3), being close to that of TiC. (C) 1999 American Institute of Physics. [S0003-6951(99)01725-8].
